definition: chicken ribs/sth of little value or interest/sth of dubious worth that one is reluctant to give up/to be physically weak

sentences.english: The fruit can also be juiced or used to make delicious sorbets or milkshakes.
sentences.chinese: 水果也可以鸡肋或用来制造美味或水果奶昔。

sentences.english: Another predicted, 'Shanghai Disneyland is likely to become a 'chicken rib' [an expression for something insignificant].
sentences.chinese: 另外一位网民预测，上海迪士尼乐园很可能成为鸡肋。

sentences.english: Let tasteless chicken ribs how to make change Xiangla filled clubs operating flavor?
sentences.chinese: 让无味鸡肋变香辣鸡翅会所经营如何做出味道？

sentences.english: It was aimed at not making haste such a wonky stat for Resto.
sentences.chinese: 它的目的是使急速对恢复德来说不那么鸡肋。

sentences.english: The Spring Festival Gala used to give us the sense of "chicken ribs" --- tasteless when eaten but a pity to throw away.
sentences.chinese: 以前对春晚的感觉就是鸡肋，食之无味，弃之可惜。

sentences.english: My feeling is that when love has become a "chicken."
sentences.chinese: 我的感觉是当爱已成为“鸡肋”。

sentences.english: You could feel there was always a reluctance for him.
sentences.chinese: 你可以感觉出这里一直有着对他的任命一种鸡肋感觉。

sentences.english: More than three years later it feels old and obsolete.
sentences.chinese: 但三年过后，感觉这一功能犹如鸡肋。

definition: lit. to be hardly worth eating, but it would still be a pity to discard it (idiom)/fig. some things have little to no value, yet one is still reluctant to part with them
pinyin: shi2 zhi1 wu2 wei4 , qi4 zhi1 ke3 xi1

definition: using a talented person in an insignificant position (idiom)/a sledgehammer to crack a nut
a neglected branch (of arts, science, sports etc)/fig. a complete unknown who wins a competition
it isn't worth it/not cost-effective/not profitable/too expensive
not one good point/everything about it is wrong
